== Main Inclusion Report for dolphin ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/d/dolphin; available for all supported architectures or some subset ?
# ''Rationale:''
** Needed for https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/kubuntu-dolphin-by-default
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=dolphin|No CVE entries]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=dolphin|No Secunia history]]</nowiki>
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.  No daemons.
** Network activity: it does not open any port.  Incoming network data handled with kioslaves, same as the rest of KDE.
** Source code review performed when moving to KDE trunk (although not as thourough as it should have been it seems).  http://websvn.kde.org/trunk/KDE/kdebase/apps/dolphin/README?view=log
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package always works out of the box without configuration
** Package does not ask debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:dolphin|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: 2 normal bugs
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/d/dolphin.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is active
** <nowiki>[[http://enzosworld.gmxhome.de/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is franetic in KDE 4.  This KDE 3 version is now maintained as "D3lphin" and we hope to include the updates soon.
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.kde.org/buglist.cgi?product=dolphin&bug_status=UNCONFIRMED&bug_status=NEW&bug_status=ASSIGNED&bug_status=REOPENED|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: nothing serious
** Hardware: Does not deal with hardware
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system cdbs
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** kdelibs
** All dependencies in main
 0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file
** Upstream call it Dolphin.  We don't plan to use the D3lphin name in packaging.
